item.title: HTTPS proxy for Merecat httpd
item.author: troglobit@gmail.com (Joachim Nilsson)
item.description: This is a HTTPS proxy HowTo for Merecat httpd using pound and OpenSSL. Pound is a reverse proxy, load balancer, and HTTPS front-end for Web servers. It is available in Debian/Ubuntu and is very simple to set up: First install the package, including OpenSSL, or LibreSSL: sudo apt install pound openssl Use OpenSSL to create a self-signed certificate: mkdir ~/certs cd ~/certs openssl req -x509 -newkey rsa:4096 -keyout key.pem -out cert.
